title: The First Declaration
description: Declare an integer variable `x` and set it to 42. Print it to the console.

title: Type Juggler
description: Read an integer from input, multiply it by 2, and print the result.
hints: Use `cout << n * 2;` to print the doubled value

title: The Swapper
description: Read two integers `a` and `b`, then print them swapped (b first, then a), separated by a space.
hints: You can use a temp variable, or just print in reverse order

title: The Counter
description: Read an integer `n` and print numbers from 1 to n, each on a new line.
hints: Use a `for` loop: `for (int i = 1; i <= n; i++)`
Print each number with `cout << i << endl;`

title: Sum Seeker
description: Read an integer `n` and print the sum of all integers from 1 to n.
hints: Use a loop to accumulate: `sum += i;`

title: FizzBuzz Knight
description: Read `n`. For each number 1 to n: print "Fizz" if divisible by 3, "Buzz" if by 5, "FizzBuzz" if by both, else the number. One per line.

test_cases.expected_output:
1
2
Fizz
4
Buzz
Fizz
7
8
Fizz
Buzz
11
Fizz
13
14
FizzBuzz
test_cases.name: fifteen

hints: Check divisibility by 15 first (FizzBuzz), then 3, then 5

title: The Reverser
description: Read an integer `n`, then `n` integers. Print them in reverse order, separated by spaces.
hints: Store the numbers in an array first, then loop backwards

title: The Factorial
description: Write a function `factorial(int n)` that returns n!. Read n from input and print factorial(n).
hints: Or use a loop: result *= i for i in 1..n

title: Hello Coder
description: Print 'Hello, World!' to the console.
hints: Use cout to print.Output should match exactly, including punctuation and capitalization.

title: The First Declaration
description: Declare an integer variable `x` and set it to 42. Print it to the console.

title: Type Juggler
description: Read an integer from input, multiply it by 2, and print the result.
hints: Use cin >> n; to read input
Use cout << n * 2; to print the doubled value

title: The Calculator
description: Read two integers and print their sum, difference, product, and quotient (integer division), each on a new line.
hints: Read two variables: cin >> a >> b;
Print each result on a new line

title: The Swapper
description: Read two integers `a` and `b`, then print them swapped (b first, then a), separated by a space.
hints: You can use a temp variable, or just print in reverse order

title: Even or Odd
description: Read an integer and print 'Even' if it's even, 'Odd' if it's odd.

title: Max of Two
description: Read two integers and print the larger one.

title: Temperature Converter
description: Read a temperature in Celsius and print it in Fahrenheit. Formula: F = C * 9/5 + 32
hints: Use float or double for accuracy

title: Simple Grade
description: Read a score (0-100). Print 'Pass' if score >= 50, otherwise 'Fail'.

title: Circle Area
description: Read the radius of a circle and print its area. Use 3.14 for PI. Area = PI * r * r

title: The Counter
description: Read an integer `n` and print numbers from 1 to n, each on a new line.
hints: Use a for loop: for (int i = 1; i <= n; i++)
Print each number with cout << i << endl;

title: Sum Seeker
description: Read an integer `n` and print the sum of all integers from 1 to n.
hints: Use a loop to accumulate: sum += i;

title: Pattern Printer
description:
Read integer n. Print n lines where line i has i asterisks. Example: n=3 prints:
*
**
***
hints: Use nested loops: outer for rows, inner for stars
for (int j = 0; j < i; j++) cout << "*";

title: FizzBuzz Knight
description: Read `n`. For each number 1 to n: print 'Fizz' if divisible by 3, 'Buzz' if by 5, 'FizzBuzz' if by both, else the number. One per line.

test_cases.expected_output:
1
2
Fizz
4
Buzz
Fizz
7
8
Fizz
Buzz
11
Fizz
13
14
FizzBuzz
test_cases.name: fifteen

hints: Check divisibility by 15 first (FizzBuzz), then 3, then 5

title: String Length
description: Read a string (one word) and print its length.

title: Reverse String
description: Read a string and print it reversed.

title: Palindrome Checker
description: Read a string. Print 'Yes' if it's a palindrome, 'No' otherwise.
hints: Or use two pointers from both ends

title: Vowel Counter
description: Read a string and count the number of vowels (a, e, i, o, u) in it. Case-insensitive.

title: Generic Max
description: Write a template function `maximum` that returns the larger of two values. Test with integers.
hints: T maximum(T a, T b) { return (a > b) ? a : b; }

title: Array Sum
description: Read integer n, then n integers. Print their sum.
hints: Use an array or accumulate as you read

title: First Class
description: Create a class `Rectangle` with width and height. Implement a method `area()` that returns the area. Read w and h, create object, print area.
hints: class Rectangle { public: int width, height; int area() { return width * height; } };
Create object: Rectangle rect; rect.width = w; rect.height = h;

title: Constructor Challenge
description: Create class `Circle` with radius. Implement constructor and method `getArea()`. Use 3.14 for PI.

title: Encapsulation Master
description: Create class `BankAccount` with private balance. Implement deposit(), withdraw(), and getBalance() methods. Start with 0, read n operations: 'd amount' for deposit, 'w amount' for withdraw. Print final balance.

title: Inheritance Basics
description: Create base class `Animal` with method speak(). Create derived class `Dog` that overrides speak() to print 'Woof'. Create a Dog object and call speak().
hints: class Animal { public: virtual void speak() {} };
class Dog : public Animal { public: void speak() { cout << "Woof"; } };

title: Static Members
description: Create class `Counter` with static int count. Increment count in constructor. Read n, create n Counter objects, print final count.

title: Operator Overloading
description: Create class `Complex` with real and imaginary parts. Overload + operator. Read two complex numbers (r1 i1 r2 i2), add them, print result as 'r+i'.

title: Polymorphism Power
description: Create base class `Shape` with virtual area(). Create `Square` and `Circle` derived classes. Read 's r w' where r is circle radius and w is square width. Print circle area then square area.
hints: virtual double area() = 0; for abstract base
Circle area: 3.14 * r * r, Square: w * w

title: Copy Constructor
description: Create class `Point` with x, y. Implement copy constructor. Read x1 y1, create p1, copy to p2, print p2's coordinates as 'x y'.
hints: Point p2 = p1; or Point p2(p1);

title: Friend Function
description: Create class `Box` with private length, width, height. Create friend function `volume()` that calculates volume. Read l, w, h and print volume.

title: Destructor Demo
description: Create class `Resource` with constructor that prints 'Acquired' and destructor that prints 'Released'. Read n, create n Resource objects in a scope. Print how many times 'Released' appears.

test_cases.expected_output:
Acquired
Acquired
Acquired
Released
Released
Released
test_cases.name: three

title: Two Sum
description: Given an array of integers and a target, find two numbers that add up to target. Print their indices (0-indexed) separated by space. Input: n, then n integers, then target.
hints: Use hash map to store values and indices
For each element, check if (target - element) exists in map

title: Valid Parentheses
description: Check if string of parentheses (){}[] is valid. Print 'Valid' or 'Invalid'.
hints: Use a stack to match opening and closing brackets
Push opening brackets, pop and match closing ones

title: Binary Search
description: Implement binary search. Read n, then n sorted integers, then target. Print index if found, -1 otherwise.
hints: Adjust left or right boundaries based on comparison

title: Linked List Reverse
description: Create a singly linked list from input. Reverse it. Print values space-separated. Input: n, then n integers.
hints: Use three pointers: prev, current, next

title: Merge Sorted Arrays
description: Read two sorted arrays and merge them into one sorted array. Input: n1, array1, n2, array2. Output: merged array.
hints: Use two pointers, one for each array
Compare and add smaller element to result

title: Maximum Subarray Sum
description: Find maximum sum of contiguous subarray (Kadane's Algorithm). Input: n, then n integers. Output: max sum.
hints: Keep track of current sum and max sum
Reset current sum if it becomes negative

title: First Non-Repeating Character
description: Find the first non-repeating character in a string. Print the character, or '-1' if none exists.
hints: Use hash map to count frequencies
Iterate again to find first with count 1

title: LCA in Binary Tree
description: Find Lowest Common Ancestor of two nodes in a binary tree. Input format: size, tree as level order (use -1 for null), then two node values. Output: LCA value.
hints: If both nodes are in left subtree, LCA is in left
If one in left and one in right, current node is LCA

title: Longest Increasing Subsequence
description: Find length of longest increasing subsequence. Input: n, then n integers. Output: LIS length.
hints: dp[i] = max length ending at index i

title: Island Counter
description: Count number of islands in a grid. 1 = land, 0 = water. Islands are connected horizontally/vertically. Input: rows, cols, then grid. Output: island count.
hints: Use DFS/BFS to mark connected lands
Count each time you start a new DFS
